column2: OKLAHOMA DMV WRITTEN TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Which shape is a railroad advance warning sign?
column8: Rectangle

column2: 2. This road sign means:
column8: All traffic must turn right

column2: 3. A red arrow on a traffic light means:
column4: You must stop and then proceed when the way is clear.
column6: You may turn in in the direction of the arrow after coming to a complete stop.
column8: You may not turn in the direction of the arrow until a green light or arrow light goes on.

column2: 4. Before turning, you should:
column4: sound your horn to alert the other drivers.
column8: change lanes.

column2: 5. _________________ your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes.
column8: It is not recommended to check

column2: 6. Your car stalls on the tracks at a railroad crossing, and a collision with a train is imminent. After getting yourself and your passengers out of the car, you should:
column8: signal the train to stop.
column10: run toward the train but stay off the tracks.

column2: 7. When approaching a blind person walking with a white cane or guide dog, drivers should yield the right-of-way.
8. Drivers must signal anytime they pull away from the curb.
9. A pedestrian in the crosswalk when the 'DON’T WALK' signal begins flashing must:
column8: stop immediately.
column10: go back and wait the “WALK” light

column2: 10. It is legal to make a left turn at a red light after stopping if:
column4: you yield to all other traffic at the intersection before proceeding.
column6: you are traveling on a one-way street and turning onto another one-way street.
column8: you are traveling on a two-way street and turning onto a two-way street.

column2: 11. When following motorcycles, drivers should:
column4: try to pass them as they have different braking capabilities than other motor vehicles.
column6: keep more space in front of their vehicle.
column8: reduce the minimum following distance.
column10: keep less space in front of their vehicle.

column2: 12. What should you do if your brakes fail?
column4: Hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it.
column6: Try pumping the brake pedal to increase pressure.
column8: Turn on your cruise control.

column2: 13. What should drivers do when they see this road sign?
column4: increase their speed to cross the intersection before a train arrives.
column8: slow down, look for a train, and be prepared to stop.
column10: come to a complete stop and wait for a train to cross.

column2: 14. When driving in rainy weather, you should:
column8: drive in low gear.

column2: 15. When you see this sign you should:
column8: watch for traffic to the right.

column2: 16. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: the road surface ahead changes to a low-type surface or earth road.
column6: vehicles must leave the pavement immediately.
column8: the dirt on the side of the road is soft.

column2: 17. What happens if two vehicles reach at the same time an intersection with four-way stop signs?
column6: The driver on the right yields to the driver on the left.
column8: The driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.
column10: The first vehicle to reach the intersection must yield.

column2: 18. Blind spots are:
column4: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that the driver cannot see with use of mirrors.
column6: Dangerous intersection where the maximum speed limit is 15 MPH or less.
column8: At night, the darkest areas of a road, where emergency flashers should be used.

column2: 19. You must yield to other drivers:
column4: when it helps to prevent collisions.
column6: when the other drivers are on your left and you have reached an unmarked intersection at the same time.
column8: when your traffic signal is a green.
column10: when they are driving a truck.

column2: 20. At a stop sign there is no stop line, you must stop:
column8: before the traffic light turns red.

column2: 21. This sign warns drivers that:
column8: drivers in the left lane have the right-of-way
column10: there is a one lane bridge ahead.

column2: 22. At a crosswalk:
column4: construction workers must yield to drivers.
column8: pedestrians must yield to drivers.

column2: 23. When they see this road sign, drivers should:
column6: watch for this species crossing the road.
column8: be ready to hit a reindeer.
column10: drive carefully because the animal pictured on the sign is extremely rare in the area.

column2: 24. If a driver follows you too closely, you should:
column4: move to another lane if possible.
column6: increase your speed as you are probably driving too slowly.
column8: activate your stop lights.

column2: 25. Drivers should make room for cars entering freeways by:
column6: moving over a lane if there is no other vehicle next to them.
column8: slowing down.
